nodes.name: Feature engineering
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to Schema tab and Refresh the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
select key as segment, max(acoustic_data) as max_a,
       min(acoustic_data) as min_a,
       avg(acoustic_data) as avg_a, 
       stddev(acoustic_data) as std_a, 
       variance(acoustic_data) as var_a,
       PERCENTILE(acoustic_data, 0.5) as p_50 ,
      PERCENTILE(acoustic_data, 0.25) as p_25,
      PERCENTILE(acoustic_data, 0.75) as p_75,
      last_value(time_to_failure) as time_to_failure_label from sample_table group by key
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.title: Handle Invalid
fields.description: How to handle invalid data (NULL values). Options are 'skip' (filter out rows with invalid data), 'error' (throw an error), or 'keep' (return relevant number of NaN in the output).

nodes.name: Split train data into 80-20
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data. For example, if the fraction is .7, it would split the data into 2 DataFrames, one containing 70% of the rows(passed from lower edge id to next node) and the other containing the remaining 30%(passed from higher edge id to next node).

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: fraction1
fields.title: Fraction 1
fields.description: Fraction to be used for Splitting the DataFrame into two. The first DataFrame would go to the lower edge output. The other would go to the higher edge output.

nodes.name: RandomForestRegression
nodes.description: It supports both continuous and categorical features.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: featuresCol
fields.title: Features Column
fields.description: Features column of type vectorUDT for model fitting

fields.name: labelCol
fields.title: Label Column
fields.description: The label column for model fitting

fields.name: predictionCol
fields.title: Prediction Column
fields.description: The prediction column created during model scoring.

fields.name: featureSubsetStrategy
fields.title: Feature Subset Strategy
fields.description: The number of features to consider for splits at each tree node.

fields.name: impurity
fields.title: Impurity
fields.description: The Criterion used for information gain calculation

fields.name: maxBins
fields.title: Max Bins
fields.description: The maximum number of bins used for discretizing continuous features.Must be >= 2 and >= number of categories in any categorical feature.

fields.name: maxDepth
fields.title: Max Depth
fields.description: The Maximum depth of a tree

fields.name: minInfoGain
fields.title: Min Information Gain
fields.description: The Minimum information gain for a split to be considered at a tree node

fields.name: minInstancesPerNode
fields.title: Min Instances Per Node
fields.description: The Minimum number of instances each child must have after split

fields.name: numTrees
fields.title: Num Trees
fields.description: The number of trees to train

fields.name: subsamplingRate
fields.title: Subsampling Rate
fields.description: The fraction of the training data used for learning each decision tree.

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: The random seed

fields.name: cacheNodeIds
fields.title: Cache Node Ids
fields.description: The caching nodes IDs. Can speed up training of deeper trees.

fields.name: checkpointInterval
fields.title: Checkpoint Interval
fields.description: The checkpoint interval. E.g. 10 means that the cache will get checkpointed every 10 iterations.Set checkpoint interval (>= 1) or disable checkpoint (-1)

fields.name: maxMemoryInMB
fields.title: Max memory
fields.description: Maximum memory in MB allocated to histogram aggregation.

fields.name: minWeightFractionPerNode
fields.title: Min weight fraction per node
fields.description: Minimum fraction of the weighted sample count that each child must have after split

fields.name: bootstrap
fields.title: Bootstrap
fields.description: Whether bootstrap samples are used when building trees.

fields.name: weightCol
fields.title: Weight Column
fields.description: Param for weight column name. If this is not set or empty, we treat all instance weights as 1.0.

fields.name: minInfoGainGrid
fields.title: Min Info Gain Grid Search
fields.description: Min Info Gain Grid Search

fields.name: maxBinsGrid
fields.title: Max Bins Grid Search
fields.description: Max Bins for Grid Search

fields.name: maxDepthGrid
fields.title: Max Depth Grid Search
fields.description: Regularization Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: numTreesGrid
fields.title: Num Trees Grid Search
fields.description: Number of trees for Grid Search

fields.description: Width of note

fields.title: Height
fields.description: Height of note

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
https://www.kaggle.com/c/LANL-Earthquake-Prediction


1) Split the train data into segments = num_rows_test_data/rows_in_each_segment=150000 - Done via the node ZipWithIndex and group the data

2) Then create features per segment basis. - Achieved by feature engineering node.

3) Train the RandomForest regression model. (check the feature importance metrics)


The idea while doing feature engineering is to split the data into segments and create features per segment basis. Why do we do this? This is one way of creating features which seems to be working. There can be many other ways to create more features, run the model and check back if there is a boost in accuracy and re-iterate.
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow

Group data on id divided by length of data as key

Create features per segment basis

Create feature vector from input

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Random Forest Regression is a supervised learning model that uses ensemble learning method for regression. Ensemble learning method is a technique that combines predictions from multiple models to make prediction accurately than a single model.

1- pick random k points from training data

2 - Create models on picked k points

3 - For new data create multiple trees and select average for predicted value from multiple trees
fields.title: Comment
